to_address: "Speakup is a screen review system for Linux." <speakup@braille.uwo.ca>
subject: Re: DECpc is silent
body:
I have the card only, and nothing to compare it against for size.  I
will see what I can dig up for alternative drivers (I used the drivers
from the archive).

Thanks, and have a great day.

On Mon, Jun 04, 2007 at 07:22:31PM -0500, Adam Myrow wrote:
> On Mon, 4 Jun 2007, Ralph W. Reid wrote:
> 
> > Nothing concerning the decpc shows up in /var/log/syslog.
> 
> Which drivers are you using?  Are they the ones that came with the 
> archive, or those that came with the Dectalk PC?  The ones that came with 
> the archive are for the Dectalk PC 1.  If you have the Dectalk PC 2, they 
> won't work.  If in doubt, use the drivers that originally came with the 
> card.  They should be on a 3.5-inch disk.  The Dectalk PC 2 is smaller 
> than the Dectalk PC 1.

-- 
Ralph.  N6BNO.  Wisdom comes from central processing, not from I/O.
rreid@sunset.net  http://personalweb.sunset.net/~rreid
...passing through The City of Internet at the speed of light...
PARABOLA = x ^ 2
